sentence: If you get your healthcare through Medicaid and Medicare, you are  feeling alarmed at this administration's intent to gut these essential  programs.

sentence: I spoke to families who told me that they didn't know how they would  be able to afford healthcare once their Medicaid is cut, once the  effective date kicks in.

sentence: Keep your hands off our healthcare, our Medicaid, and the  Affordable Care Act.

sentence: Today, nearly 80 million Americans receive healthcare through  Medicaid, which provides critical care throughout all stages of life.

sentence: Speaker, I rise today because healthcare through  Medicaid, covering more than 10 percent of residents and more than 30  percent of all kids in New Hampshire, is on the line.

sentence: If your wife has breast cancer, you have big bills to pay because  they want to take away healthcare, whether it is Medicaid to tens of  millions of people, half a trillion dollars for Medicare for seniors  and people with disabilities, and millions of dollars added to the cost  for families to access the Affordable Care Act.
title: Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2026

sentence: I think about all of the babies I have delivered whose moms got their  healthcare through Medicaid and how critical that was to help them get  off to the best possible start.

sentence: Instead of gutting healthcare  and Medicaid and food assistance in our public school system, Congress  should make the ultrarich pay more taxes and make these programs work  better for the people.
